label: 笙
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: A reed mouth organ usually with seventeen thin bamboo pipes, of which fifteen produce a sound when the player exhales or inhales through the mouthpiece of the instrument. Often used to play harmonies of five or six pitches. See gagaku.［雅楽］
